definitions.meaning: 强烈要求某事发生或被执行
definitions.usage: 指某人以坚定的态度要求某事必须发生，通常不接受拒绝或妥协。常用于表达对某事的坚持或强制性要求。

examples.scene: 在一家餐厅，顾客发现食物不符合预期，向服务员提出要求。
examples.chineseIdea: 顾客对食物质量不满意，强烈要求更换菜品，不接受服务员的解释。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The customer @ @ @ a new dish because the one served was cold.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The customer 「insisted on」 getting a new dish because the one served was cold.
examples.chineseTranslation: 顾客「坚持要求」换一道新菜，因为端上来的菜是冷的。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：He strongly asked to change the dish. 纠正：He insisted on getting a new dish.

examples.scene: 在公司会议中，经理对团队的工作进度不满意，提出明确要求。
examples.chineseIdea: 经理认为项目进度落后，要求团队必须加班完成任务。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The manager @ @ @ the project be completed by Friday.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The manager 「insisted that」 the project be completed by Friday.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经理「坚持要求」项目必须在周五之前完成。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：The manager said the project must finish by Friday. 纠正：The manager insisted that the project be completed by Friday.

definitions.meaning: 坚定地声明或主张某事为真
definitions.usage: 指某人反复强调某事是真实的，通常是为了纠正误解或坚持自己的观点。常用于表达对某个事实或信念的坚持。

examples.scene: 在朋友聚会中，有人误解了某人的行为，引发争论。
examples.chineseIdea: 某人被误认为说谎，坚定地声明自己没有做错任何事。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Despite the accusations, she @ @ @ she was telling the truth.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Despite the accusations, she 「insisted that」 she was telling the truth.
examples.chineseTranslation: 尽管被指责，她「坚持说」自己说的是真话。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：She said strongly she didn’t lie. 纠正：She insisted that she was telling the truth.

examples.scene: 在法庭上，嫌疑人面对指控，试图为自己辩护。
examples.chineseIdea: 嫌疑人面对证据 Roscoe insists that he is not guilty.
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Even under pressure, he @ @ @ his innocence.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Even under pressure, he 「insisted on」 his innocence.
examples.chineseTranslation: 即使在压力下，他「坚持说」自己无罪。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：He said he is not guilty. 纠正：He insisted on his innocence.
